# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here's how you can solve this problem in Julia using DataFrames.jl package for data manipulation:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[Symbol("dt")], "yyyymm")  # Extract year and month from dt, format them as string, then convert back to integer
    return df
end
```
In this function, we are using `Dates.format` method of DataFrames.jl package that takes DateTime object and a formatting string as input. The string "yyyymm" formats the date into the desired format i.e., year (yyyy) and month(mm). 

The function then adds this new column to the original DataFrame `df`. 

Remember, in Julia indexing of columns is done using `Symbol` type or a string representation of the column name. Hence we use `Symbol("dt")` instead of `"dt"`.
